definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: This is the victory of the October Revolution in Russia after the encounter is a new topic.
sentences.chinese: 这是俄国十月革命胜利后遇到的一个新课题。

sentences.english: Today celebrates 24 anniversaries of the revolution victory of October under the condition of serious.
sentences.chinese: 今天是在严重情况下庆祝十月革命胜利24周年的。

sentences.english: The February and October Revolutions in Russia were just wars.
sentences.chinese: 俄国的二月革命和十月革命是义战。

sentences.english: American anti-communism campaign has begun before October Revolution of Russia. It is mainly aiming at the radicalism which includes the communism.
sentences.chinese: 美国反共主义的进程，早在十月革命前就已经开启。

sentences.english: The October Revolution brought Marxism-Leninism to China.
sentences.chinese: 十月革命给中国带来了马列主义。

sentences.english: At least that is the way the February and October revolutions in Russia reached their climaxes.
sentences.chinese: 至少俄国的二月革命和十月革命就是这样进入高潮的。

sentences.english: The language was standardized after the October Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 十月革命之后阿迪格语完成语言标准化。

sentences.english: The October Revolution took place in 1917.
The Chinese revolution is a continuation of the great October Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 中国革命是伟大的十月革命的继续。

sentences.english: Before the October Revolution, Social contradictions in Russia were become more and more intensity, the opportunity of revolution increasingly maturated.
sentences.chinese: 十月革命前，俄国社会矛盾激化，革命时机日益成熟。

sentences.english: After the October Revolution (1917), he threw himself into the struggle of defending the political power of Soviet.
sentences.chinese: 十月革命后投身于捍卫苏维埃政权的斗争。

sentences.english: This paragraph relates to the October Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 这一节内容是论述十月革命的。

sentences.english: The Great October Revolution broke out (took place) in 1917.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的十月革命发生于1917年。

definition: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Paris Commune 1871, an unsuccessful proletarian uprising against the French Third Republic
Petrograd, variant spelling of 彼得堡[Bi3 de2 bao3], Saint Petersburg
Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
